page.title: 17GRAVEL INDUSTRY NEAR TADLEY
page.content: The Kennet Valley is a rich source of high quality gravel much needed for the building programmes in West Berk- shire and North Hampshire. A new scheme due to start late in 1985 will entail the extraction of 150,000 tonnes per year of aggregates from pits just outside the survey area. At 20 tonnes per lorry the estimated number of lorry movements is 15,000 per year or an average of 54.5 per day. These will travel through Wasing and Aldermaston over old narrow bridges and winding lanes, as well as through a village street before reach- ing the processing plant at Paices Hill. The Thames Water Authority were called out nine times in a week to one village recently to repair broken water mains, their verdict was that this was due to too much heavy traffic with too high an axle loading.
